posts.name: csos
posts.cooked:
Hi everyone,

I’m working with YAGSL for swerve drive, and I want my robot to align precisely to a target using TX from Limelight. Since I’m new to YAGSL , I’m looking for the best approach to achieve this. Should I use PID for steering, or is there a better method?

For example I want the robot to move right and left based on the TX value without changing its rotation. How can I properly integrate Limelight data into YAGSL ’s drive commands? If you’ve implemented something similar before, I’d love to hear your best practices!

Thanks!
I would use MegaTag2 and fuse that pose with SwerveDrive.addVisionMeasurement then do your aligning off of SwerveDrive.getOdometryPose()

posts.name: csos
posts.cooked:
I understand that after using MegaTag2 and fusing the pose with SwerveDrive.addVisionMeasurement , I should align using SwerveDrive.getOdometryPose() .

But what exactly is the alignment command in this case? How do I perform the alignment after fusing the odometry with MegaTag2?

What I’m trying to do is this: Let’s say the TX value is 0 . I want the robot to move left or right until the TX value reaches 10 . How can I achieve this in YAGSL ?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Head Coach Bronc Botz FRC3481, FTC4008/4602/6976

posts.cooked: Custom drive command with a PID based off the TX, robot relative control only the Y axis. Should be possible to sim with PhotonVision

posts.name: Guilherme
posts.cooked: this is the same method swerveDrive.getPose(), if isnt, the pose reported is the same pose of LL odometry, or is only the modules odometry?

posts.name: icemannie
posts.cooked: There are three levels of 3D AprilTag tracking in Limelight OS:

You can take a look at our code

It uses pid to align to the closest tag using tx ty tz with a boolean to choose if you want to align to the right or left pipe

posts.cooked: Thanks for posting this example.  I can’t seem to figure out where in your code you choose the closest tag.  Is there some code somewhere which chooses between April tags in the case where more than one is seen by the camera?

In the limelight web interface there is an option to choose what tag to focus on one of the options is closest

posts.name: Ambrish

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
ambrish3281:

Error at frc.robot.AlignToReefTagRelative.execute(AlignToReefTagRelative.java:66): Unhandled exception: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Index 2 out of bounds for length 0

What is at that line? I suspect you’re referencing a tag that isn’t being seen.
It looks like you are trying to read from an array before you put any data in it

posts.name: Ambrish
posts.cooked:
Thank you @Kully . This was an issue with Limelight not enabled with 3D mode. After enabling it, it is working fine now.

BTW, for us to align perfectly does it matter if Limelight is in Center of the Robot OR it can be placed on the side as well ?

Thank you for your help and inputs.

-Ambrish
It can be placed to the side but notice the x value of the alignment want be the same but minus it would be diffrent for each 1 of the 2 polls of the reef
This means you need to aling you robot to the right poll of the reef keep the value and than do the same to the left poll

posts.name: Ambrish
posts.cooked:
Got it. Thank you @Kully One more follow up question. If Limelight is mounted in Center and if we want align in the center of 1/6 of Reff than we can remove this x value offset.

Thanks. -Ambrish

Yes if you want to align that the limelight would be exactly in middle of the tag than you would put x setpoint as 0 if you want it to end to the right you would put a positive value and if you want it to the left put a negative value
